newsitem.title: UK: Half UK jobless fall from job creation - Heseltine.
newsitem.headline: Half UK jobless fall from job creation - Heseltine.

text.p: Britain's deputy Prime Minister Michael Heseltine said on Tuesday around half the fall in unemployment in recent months was due to job creation, with the other half coming from the introduction of the Jobseekers Allowance.

"Something like half the reduction that we're seeing today is through what is new jobs and the other half is people who are leaving the unemployment claims register...in other words these are precisely the people that the Jobseekers Allowance in part was designed to flush out," he told reporters at a news conference.
The Jobseekers Allowance was introduced in October and requiries claimants to provide additional evidence that they are actively seeking work.
Heseltine said the JSA was catching up with people who had been cheating the system and moonlighting -- working while claiming benefit. "The jobseekers allowance is flushing this out."
